intro: Draba nipponica var. linearis, commonly known as the linear draba, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The species is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and produces small, yellow or white flowers in early spring. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
